title: Welcome To My Blog
text:
This is the first post in a Quarto blog. Welcome!

Since this post doesn’t specify an explicit image, the first image in the post will be used in the listing page of posts.

title: Usage
text:
Follow the instructions on the Quarto website.
Install also the extension for your code editor, e.g., Quarto for VS Code.



Install the uv package manager for using python in this repository. Follow the instructions in the uv documentation.
To run a script with uv, use the command:
uv run <my_script.py>
To build a environment reflecting the dependencies in pyproject.toml, use:
uv sync




To preview the site locally with a live server, you can use the following command:
quarto preview
This will start a local server and open the site in your default web browser. Any changes you make to the source files will automatically refresh the browser.



To render the site locally, you can use the following command:
quarto render
This will generate the static files for the site in the _site directory. Additionally, it will save the results of computatations in the _freeze directory, that should be checked into version control, such that the site can be deployed (e.g. with GitHub Actions) without re-running computations.



Documentation for deploying the site on github pages can be found in quarto’s documentation.
Briefly, to deploy the site, you can push the changes to your GitHub repository if you have set up GitHub Pages or any other hosting service. Make sure to commit and push all changes before deployment.
git add .
git commit -m "Update site"
git push origin main


Then, to build the site locally, run (on the main branch):
quarto publish gh-pages
This command will build the site and publish it to the gh-pages branch of your GitHub repository.
To update the publications list from ORCID, run:
uv run fetch_orcid.py



Is done using the CI workflow defined in .github/workflows/deploy.yml, which is triggered on pushes to the main branch.

text: Hi, this is my blog. My newest posts are:

title: Publications
text:
E. Henningsson, C. Schulze, J. Aka, M. Gräber, D. Brück, E. Nahodovic, & O. Lenord. (2025). Input smoothing for faster co-simulation using FMI. Linköping Electronic Conference Proceedings. https://doi.org: 10.3384/ecp218653.


J. Aka, J. Brunnemann, J. Eiden, A. Speerforck, & L. Mikelsons. (2024). Balanced neural ODEs: Nonlinear model order reduction and koopman operator approximations. arXiv. https://doi.org: 10.48550/ARXIV.2410.10174.


J. Aka, J. Brunnemann, S. Freund, & A. Speerforck. (2023). Efficient global multi parameter calibration for complex system models using machine-learning surrogates. Modelica conferences, 107–120. https://doi.org: 10.3384/ecp204107.

title: Post With Code
text:
This is a post with executable code.

    print('hello world')

hello world
